activities.name: Copy LineItems from Main to DimTab
activities.description:
It copies DV360Main[LineItem] & DV360Main[LineItemID] unique values to [0003].[DimTabDV360LineItem].
It will also add a new column LineItemName2 by performing a search in [0003].[LineItemName2Map].
The search consist on finding the first Map[value] that has Map[Key] as substring of DimTabDV360LineItem[LineItem], and assign it to DimTabDV360LineItem[LineItemName2].

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT DISTINCT [LineItemID], [LineItem],
(
    SELECT TOP(1) [Value]
    FROM [0003].[LineItemName2Map] linm
    WHERE CHARINDEX(linm.[Key], main.LineItem ) > 0
) AS [LineItemName2]

FROM [0003].[DV360Main] main

IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects O JOIN sys.schemas S ON O.schema_id = S.schema_id WHERE O.NAME = '[GoogleAdsCampaign]' AND O.TYPE = 'U' AND S.NAME = '[0002]')
CREATE TABLE [0002].[GoogleAdsCampaign]
	(
	 [Date] date,
	 [Campaign State] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Campaign Type] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Impressions] bigint,
	 [Clicks] bigint,
	 [Campaign Name] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Taxonomy Check] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Business Unit] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Spend EUR] bigint,
	 [Platform Name] bigint,
	 [Unique ID] bigint,
	 [PSCID] bigint,
	 [Platform PSCID] nvarchar(4000)
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = ROUND_ROBIN,
	 HEAP
	 -- CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	)
GO

--Uncomment the 4 lines below to create a stored procedure for data pipeline orchestration
--CREATE PROC bulk_load_[GoogleAdsCampaign]
--AS
--BEGIN
COPY INTO [0002].[GoogleAdsCampaign]
(Date 1, [Campaign State] 2, [Campaign Type] 3, Impressions 4, Clicks 5, [Campaign Name] 6, [Taxonomy Check] 7, [Business Unit] 8, [Spend EUR] 9, [Platform Name] 10, [Unique ID] 11, PSCID 12, [Platform PSCID] 13)
FROM 'https://adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/dataxsynapsefs/0002/0002.GoogleAdsCampaign.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,DATEFORMAT = 'dmy'
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/dataxsynapsefs/0002/'
)
--END
GO

SELECT TOP 100 * FROM [0002].[GoogleAdsCampaign]
GO

        BULK 'https://adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/dataxsynapsefs/Training/Lisseth/GoogleAds.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',

CREATE PROC [dbo].[Update_Country_Brand]
AS
BEGIN
UPDATE lgads
SET 
    lgads.CountryID = lc.CountryName,
    lgads.BrandID = lb.BrandName
FROM [Lisseth].[GoogleAds] lgads
LEFT JOIN [Lisseth].[Country]  lc ON lgads.CountryID = lc.CountryID
LEFT JOIN [Lisseth].[Brand]  lb ON lgads.BrandID = lb.BrandID
END

SELECT TOP (100) [id]
,[name]
,[box_art_url]
,[igdb_id]
 FROM [Mario].[TopGames] WHERE igdb_id IS NOT NULL

CREATE USER Mario FOR LOGIN Mario

GRANT SELECT ON Mario.v_topgames TO Mario

EXECUTE AS USER='Mario'

SELECT * FROM Mario.topgames

UPDATE lgads
SET 
    lgads.CountryID = lc.CountryName,
    lgads.BrandID = lb.BrandName
FROM [Lisseth].[GoogleAds] lgads
LEFT JOIN [Lisseth].[Country]  lc ON lgads.CountryID = lc.CountryID
LEFT JOIN [Lisseth].[Brand]  lb ON lgads.BrandID = lb.BrandID

properties.description:
This script load all the data asociated with the existing streamers in our streamersCsv table.
For this reason it has to load streamersCsv data first
Estimate run time = 25 min

source:
This script load all the data asociated with the **existing streamers** in our **streamersCSV** table.
For this reason it has to load streamersCSV data first.
Needs to be updated **infrequently**.

Estimate run time = **25 - 50 min**

import requests
import json
import time
import pandas as pd
from requests.structures import CaseInsensitiveDict
from notebookutils import mssparkutils

STREAMERS_FILENAME = "abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/Training/Cristian/Streamers.csv"
FILENAME = "abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/Training/Cristian/StreamersData.csv"

start_time = time.time()
streamersCSV = spark.read.csv(STREAMERS_FILENAME, header=True, inferSchema=True)
streamersCSV_df = streamersCSV.toPandas()
#streamersCSV_df = streamersCSV.drop_duplicates(subset="user_name")
headers = CaseInsensitiveDict()
secret = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS('ls_keyvault', 'TwitchSecret')
headers["Authorization"] = "Bearer " + secret
headers["Client-Id"] = "euj1dlm3po5d9e0xi03am76u5jhyz9"
Load Streamers data. Iterate the **Streamers_id.csv** table wich stores all the streamers who have been found and returns a **CSV** with all his public data.

streamersData = pd.DataFrame()
for streamer in streamersCSV_df.index:
    currentStreamer = str(streamersCSV_df['user_id'][streamer])
    url = "https://api.twitch.tv/helix/users?id=" + currentStreamer
    resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    streamer_obj = json.loads(resp.text)
    streamers_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(streamer_obj["data"])

    url = "https://api.twitch.tv/helix/channels/followers?broadcaster_id=" + currentStreamer
    resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    followers_obj = json.loads(resp.text)
    streamers_df["language"] = streamersCSV_df["language"][streamer]
    streamers_df["followers"] = followers_obj["total"]

    if 'description' in streamers_df.columns and not streamers_df['description'].isnull().all():
        streamers_df["description"] = streamers_df["description"].str.replace('"', "'")
        
    streamersData = pd.concat([streamersData,streamers_df], axis=0)
    followers_obj = json.loads(resp.text)
#streamersData.to_csv(FILENAME, index=False)
mssparkutils.fs.put(FILENAME, streamersData.to_csv(index=False), True)

print("--- %s seconds ---" % (time.time() - start_time))

properties.description:

source:
This script load all the data asociated with the **current streams**.
It requieres to **update frecuently**, due to show existing currently data.

Estimate run time = **3 seconds**

import requests
import json
import time
import pandas as pd
from requests.structures import CaseInsensitiveDict
from notebookutils import mssparkutils

STREAMERS_FILENAME = "abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/Training/Cristian/Streamers.csv"
STREAMS_FILENAME = "abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/Training/Cristian/Streams.csv"

start_time = time.time()
#streamersCSV = mssparkutils.fs.head(STREAMERS_FILENAME)
streamersCSV = spark.read.csv(STREAMERS_FILENAME, header=True, inferSchema=True)
tuples = set([tuple(x) for x in streamersCSV.collect()])

headers = CaseInsensitiveDict()
secret = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS('ls_keyvault', 'TwitchSecret')
headers["Authorization"] = "Bearer " + secret
headers["Client-Id"] = "euj1dlm3po5d9e0xi03am76u5jhyz9"

languages = ["en", "es", "fr", "pt", "de", "zh", "ja", "ar", "it", "ru"]
Load Top Streams data. Returns a **json** with the current 100 streams wich have **more viewers**. This data **changes a lot** in a short period of time so outdated data may be displayed

aux_df = pd.DataFrame()
for language in languages:
    url = "https://api.twitch.tv/helix/streams?first=100&language=" + language
    resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    streams_obj = json.loads(resp.text)
    streams_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(streams_obj["data"])
    for stream in streams_df.index:
        tuples.add(tuple([int(streams_df['user_id'][stream]),streams_df['user_name'][stream],streams_df['language'][stream]]))
    streams_df["title"] = streams_df["title"].str.replace('"', "'")
    aux_df = pd.concat([aux_df,streams_df], axis=0)

mssparkutils.fs.put(STREAMS_FILENAME, aux_df.to_csv(index=False), True)
streamers_df = pd.DataFrame(set(tuples),columns=['user_id', 'user_name', 'language'])
streamers_df = streamers_df.drop_duplicates(subset="user_id", keep="first")
mssparkutils.fs.put(STREAMERS_FILENAME, streamers_df.to_csv(index=False), True)

print("--- %s seconds ---" % (time.time() - start_time))

properties.description:
# This script load all the data asociated with the top games and its videos
# Estimate run time = 40 seconds

source:
import requests
import json
import time
import pandas as pd
from requests.structures import CaseInsensitiveDict
from notebookutils import mssparkutils

STREAMERS_FILENAME = "abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/Training/Cristian/Streamers.csv"
TOP_GAMES_FILENAME = "abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/Training/Cristian/TopGames.csv"
ALL_TOP_VIDEOS_FILENAME = "abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net/Training/Cristian/AllTopGames.csv"

start_time = time.time()
streamersCSV = spark.read.csv(STREAMERS_FILENAME, header=True, inferSchema=True)
tuples = set([tuple(x) for x in streamersCSV.collect()])

headers = CaseInsensitiveDict()
secret = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS('ls_keyvault', 'TwitchSecret')
headers["Authorization"] = "Bearer " + secret
headers["Client-Id"] = "euj1dlm3po5d9e0xi03am76u5jhyz9"

languages = ["en", "es", "fr", "pt", "de", "zh", "ja", "ar", "it", "ru"]
Load TopGames data. Returns a **json** with 100 **most viewed** categories of Twitch

url = "https://api.twitch.tv/helix/games/top?first=100"
resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
topGames = json.loads(resp.text)
TopGames_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(topGames["data"])
mssparkutils.fs.put(TOP_GAMES_FILENAME, TopGames_df.to_csv(index=False), True)
Load Top Videos data. Returns a **json** with 100 **most viewed** videos of each top Category of Twitch

aux_df = pd.DataFrame()
for game in TopGames_df.index:
    currentGameID = TopGames_df['id'][game]
    string = "https://api.twitch.tv/helix/videos?first=100&game_id=" + currentGameID + "&sort=views"
    resp = requests.get(string, headers=headers)
    topVideosObj = json.loads(resp.text)
    TopVideos_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(topVideosObj["data"])
    for video in TopVideos_df.index:
        tuples.add(tuple([int(TopVideos_df['user_id'][video]),TopVideos_df['user_name'][video],TopVideos_df['language'][video]]))
    TopVideos_df["title"] = TopVideos_df["title"].str.replace('"', "'")
    TopVideos_df["description"] = TopVideos_df["description"].str.replace('"', "'")
    TopVideos_df["game_id"] = int(currentGameID)
    aux_df = pd.concat([aux_df,TopVideos_df], axis=0)
mssparkutils.fs.put(ALL_TOP_VIDEOS_FILENAME, aux_df.to_csv(index=False), True)
streamers_df = pd.DataFrame(set(tuples),columns=['user_id', 'user_name', 'language'])
streamers_df = streamers_df.drop_duplicates(subset="user_id", keep="first")
mssparkutils.fs.put(STREAMERS_FILENAME, streamers_df.to_csv(index=False), True)

print("--- %s seconds ---" % (time.time() - start_time))

import io
import os
import sys
import glob
import json
import datetime
import requests
from tqdm import tqdm
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import google_auth_httplib2
from rauth import OAuth2Service
import google.oauth2.credentials
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from googleapiclient.discovery import build as google_build
from azure.storage.filedatalake import DataLakeServiceClient
from google.ads.googleads.client import GoogleAdsClient
from google.ads.googleads.errors import GoogleAdsException

from notebookutils import mssparkutils

credentials = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS('ls_Keyvault', 'GoogleAdsAlejandroTest')
credentials = json.loads(credentials)

CLIENT_ID = credentials['CLIENT_ID']
CLIENT_SECRET = credentials['CLIENT_SECRET']
REFRESH_TOKEN = credentials['REFRESH_TOKEN']
DEVELOPER_TOKEN = credentials['DEVELOPER_TOKEN']

def get_access_token():
    access_token = None
    service = OAuth2Service(
                                name="Get Access Token - GA OAuth2",
                                client_id= CLIENT_ID,
                                client_secret=CLIENT_SECRET,
                                access_token_url="https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token",
                                base_url="https://oauth2.googleapis.com/",
                            )
    data = {'refresh_token': REFRESH_TOKEN,
            'grant_type': 'refresh_token'}
    session = service.get_auth_session(data=data, decoder=json.loads)
    return session.access_token

def getAccounts(ACCESS_TOKEN, manager_id, token):
    manager_customer_id = manager_id
    developer_token = token
    account_sql = """
                    SELECT
                      customer_client.client_customer,
                      customer_client.level,
                      customer_client.manager,
                      customer_client.descriptive_name,
                      customer_client.currency_code,
                      customer_client.time_zone,
                      customer_client.id
                    FROM customer_client
                    WHERE customer_client.level > 0
                """
    response = requests.post("https://googleads.googleapis.com/v7/customers/" + str(manager_customer_id) + "/googleAds:searchStream"
                                            ,headers={"Authorization":"Bearer " + str(ACCESS_TOKEN),
                                                      "login-customer-id":manager_customer_id,
                                                      "developer-token":developer_token}
                                            ,data={"query":account_sql}
                                            ).json()
    #List Comprehension used to pull all the accounts that are not manager accounts
    Ad_acc = [x["customerClient"]["id"] for x in response[0]["results"] if x["customerClient"]["manager"] == False]
    return Ad_acc

credentialsAds = google.oauth2.credentials.Credentials(
    ACCESS_TOKEN,
    refresh_token=REFRESH_TOKEN,
    token_uri='https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/token',
    client_id=CLIENT_ID,
    client_secret=CLIENT_SECRET
)
authorized = google_auth_httplib2.AuthorizedHttp(credentials=credentialsAds)

start_date = pd.to_datetime(start).date().isoformat().replace("-","")
end_date = pd.to_datetime(end).date().isoformat().replace("-","")

client = GoogleAdsClient.load_from_string(f"""# Developer token
##########################################################################################
# A developer token is required when making requests to the Google Ads API regardless of #
# whether you're using the OAuth2 or Service Account configurations. To obtain a         #
# developer token see:                                                                   #
# https://developers.google.com/google-ads/api/docs/first-call/dev-token                 #
##########################################################################################
developer_token: {DEVELOPER_TOKEN}

# Use proto plus
##########################################################################################
# This parameter specifies whether the client library should return proto-plus messages  #
# or protobuf messages. This value should be explicitly set to either "True" or "False", #
# For more information on the differences between these two types, see our Protobuf      #
# Messages guide:                                                                        #
# https://developers.google.com/google-ads/api/docs/client-libs/python/protobuf-messages #
##########################################################################################
use_proto_plus: True

# OAuth2 configuration
##########################################################################################
# The below configuration parameters are used to authenticate using the recommended      #
# OAuth2 flow. For more information on authenticating with OAuth2 see:                   #
# https://developers.google.com/google-ads/api/docs/oauth/overview                       #
##########################################################################################
client_id: {CLIENT_ID}
client_secret: {CLIENT_SECRET}
refresh_token: {REFRESH_TOKEN}

# Login customer ID configuration
##########################################################################################
# Required for manager accounts only: Specify the login customer ID used to authenticate #
# API calls. This will be the customer ID of the authenticated manager account. It       #
# should be set without dashes, for example: 1234567890 instead of 123-456-7890. You can #
# also specify this later in code if your application uses multiple manager account +    #
# OAuth pairs.                                                                           #
##########################################################################################
login_customer_id: 9497681898

def get_campaigns(client, customer_id):
    ga_service = client.get_service("GoogleAdsService")
    query = """
    SELECT
        campaign.id,
        campaign.name,
        ad_group.id,
        ad_group.name,
        ad_group_criterion.criterion_id,
        ad_group_criterion.keyword.text,
        ad_group_criterion.keyword.match_type,
        metrics.impressions,
        metrics.clicks,
        metrics.cost_micros
    FROM keyword_view WHERE segments.date DURING LAST_7_DAYS
    AND ad_group.status = 'ENABLED'
    AND ad_group_criterion.status IN ('ENABLED', 'PAUSED')
    ORDER BY metrics.impressions DESC"""
 
    # Issues a search request using streaming.
    search_request = client.get_type("SearchGoogleAdsStreamRequest")
    search_request.customer_id = customer_id
    search_request.query = query
    stream = ga_service.search_stream(search_request)
    final = pd.DataFrame()
    for batch in stream:
        for row in batch.results:
            campaign = row.campaign
            ad_group = row.ad_group
            criterion = row.ad_group_criterion
            metrics = row.metrics
            df = pd.DataFrame({"Campaign": campaign.name,
                          "CampaignID": campaign.id,
                          "AdGroup": ad_group.name,
                          "AdGroupID": ad_group.id,
                          "Keyword": criterion.keyword.text,
                          "MatchType": criterion.keyword.match_type,
                          "Clicks": metrics.clicks,
                          "Conversions": metrics.conversions,
                          "Costs": metrics.cost_micros ,
                          "Impressions": metrics.impressions},index=[0])
 
            final = pd.concat([final, df])
            """print(
                f'Keyword text "{criterion.keyword.text}" with '
                f'match type "{criterion.keyword.match_type.name}" '
                f"and ID {criterion.criterion_id} in "
                f'ad group "{ad_group.name}" '
                f'with ID "{ad_group.id}" '
                f'in campaign "{campaign.name}" '
                f"with ID {campaign.id} "
                f"had {metrics.impressions} impression(s), "
                f"{metrics.clicks} click(s), and "
                f"{metrics.cost_micros} cost (in micros) during "
                "the last 7 days."
            )"""
    return final

df = pd.DataFrame()

for acc in Ad_acc:
    df_tmp = get_campaigns(client, acc)
    df = pd.concat([df, df_tmp])
#df = df.drop_duplicates()

import random
def fillFakeData(df):
    df['Impressions'] = [random.uniform(0.0, 1100.5) for k in df.index]
    df['Clicks'] = [random.triangular(-100, 80, 1100) for k in df.index]
    df['Clicks'] = df['Clicks']+df['Impressions']
    df['Costs'] = [random.uniform(20, 5000) for k in df.index]
    return df

from requests.structures import CaseInsensitiveDict
import json
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import uuid

body = f'client_id={client_id}&grant_type=password&resource=https%3A%2F%2Fanalysis.windows.net%2Fpowerbi%2Fapi&{account_password}'
r = requests.post(f'https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant_id}/oauth2/token', data=body)
access_token = r.json()['access_token']

headers = CaseInsensitiveDict()
headers["Authorization"] = "Bearer " + access_token

url = "https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups"

resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
#safe_print(resp)
obj = resp.json()

groups_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(obj["value"])
groups_df["id_duplicate"] = groups_df["id"]
mssparkutils.fs.put("/PBIMetadata/Groups.csv", groups_df.to_csv(index=False), True)
#print(groups_df.head())

data_df = pd.DataFrame()
types = ["datasets", "dataflows", "reports"]
for group in groups_df["id"]:
    group = str(group)
    for _type in types:
        url = "https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups/"
        url += group + "/" + _type
        resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
        obj = resp.json()
        new_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(obj["value"])
        new_df["group_id"] = group
        new_df["type"] = _type[:-1]
        if _type == "dataflows":
            if 'objectId' in new_df.columns:
                new_df["id"] = new_df["objectId"]
        data_df = pd.concat([data_df,new_df],ignore_index=True)

#print(data_df.shape)
data_df["id_duplicate"] = data_df["id"]
mssparkutils.fs.put("/PBIMetadata/Resources.csv", data_df.to_csv(index=False), True)

report_df = data_df[data_df["type"] == "report"]
pages_df = pd.DataFrame()
for id_ in report_df["id"]:
    group = report_df[report_df["id"] == id_]["group_id"].iloc[0]
    url = "https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups/"
    url += group + "/reports/" + id_ + "/pages"
    resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    obj = resp.json()
    new_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(obj["value"])
    new_df["report_id"] = id_
    new_df["group_id"] = group
    new_df["Id"] = new_df.report_id.map(str) + new_df.name
    new_df["id_duplicate"] = new_df["report_id"].apply(lambda x: uuid.uuid4())
    pages_df = pd.concat([pages_df,new_df],ignore_index=True)
mssparkutils.fs.put("/PBIMetadata/ReportPages.csv", pages_df.to_csv(index=False), True)
#print(pages_df.shape)

# Datasources

API only allows getDatasource calls on datasets, dataflows and RDL(paginated reports). Standard reports don't support getDatasource calls.

datasources_df = pd.DataFrame()
for id_ in data_df["id"]:
    group = data_df[data_df["id"] == id_]["group_id"].iloc[0]
    resource = data_df[data_df["id"] == id_]["type"].iloc[0] + "s"
    url = "https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups/"
    url += group + "/" + resource + "/" + id_ + "/" + "datasources"
    resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    obj = resp.json()
    new_df = pd.DataFrame()
    if "value" in obj.keys():
        if len(obj["value"]) > 0:
            new_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(obj["value"])
            new_df["resource_id"] = id_
            new_df["group_id"] = group
            new_df["resource_type"] = resource[:-1]
            new_df["id"] = new_df["datasourceId"]
            new_df["id_duplicate"] = new_df["id"].apply(lambda x: uuid.uuid4())
            new_df = pd.concat([new_df.drop(['connectionDetails'], axis=1), new_df['connectionDetails'].apply(pd.Series)], axis=1)
    datasources_df = pd.concat([datasources_df,new_df],ignore_index=True)
mssparkutils.fs.put("/PBIMetadata/Datasources.csv", datasources_df.to_csv(index=False), True)
#print(datasources_df.shape)

refresh_df = pd.DataFrame()
datasets_dataflows = data_df[(data_df['type'] == 'dataset') | (data_df['type'] == 'dataflow')]
for id_ in datasets_dataflows["id"]:
    group = datasets_dataflows[datasets_dataflows["id"] == id_]["group_id"].iloc[0]
    type_ = datasets_dataflows[datasets_dataflows["id"] == id_]["type"].iloc[0] + "s"
    url = "https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups/"
    url += group + "/" + type_ + "/" + id_ + "/"
    if type_ == "datasets":
        url += "refreshes"
    else:
        url += "transactions"
    resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    obj = resp.json()
    if "value" in obj.keys(): # Direct query or live-connection based datasets will return error.
        new_df = pd.DataFrame()
        new_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(obj["value"])
        new_df["resource_id"] = id_
        new_df["group_id"] = group
        new_df["resource_type"] = type_[:-1]
        refresh_df = pd.concat([refresh_df,new_df],ignore_index=True)
refresh_df = refresh_df.astype({"id": str})
refresh_df["id_duplicate"] = np.where(pd.isnull(refresh_df["requestId"]), refresh_df["id"].apply(getID), refresh_df["requestId"])
mssparkutils.fs.put("/PBIMetadata/RefreshHistory.csv", refresh_df.to_csv(index=False), True)
#print(refresh_df.shape)

# Imports

Adding import name to data dataframe for resources created when importing .pbix files

imports_df = pd.DataFrame()
for group in groups_df["id"]:
    group = str(group)
    url = "https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups/"
    url += group + "/" + "imports"
    resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    obj = resp.json()
    if "value" in obj.keys():
        new_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(obj["value"])
        new_df["group_id"] = group
        imports_df = pd.concat([imports_df,new_df],ignore_index=True)

data_df["import_name"] = ""

#mssparkutils.fs.put("/PBIMetadata/Imports.csv", imports_df.to_csv(index=False), True)

for id_ in imports_df["id"]:
    name = imports_df[imports_df["id"] == id_]["name"].iloc[0]
    datasets = imports_df[imports_df["id"] == id_]["datasets"].iloc[0]
    reports = imports_df[imports_df["id"] == id_]["reports"].iloc[0]
    dataflows = imports_df[imports_df["id"] == id_]["dataflows"].iloc[0]
    for dataset in datasets:
        data_df.loc[data_df["id"] == dataset["id"], "import_name"] = name
        data_df.loc[data_df["id"] == dataset["id"], "isFromPbix"] = "TRUE"
    for report in reports:
        data_df.loc[data_df["id"] == report["id"], "import_name"] = name
        data_df.loc[data_df["id"] == report["id"], "isFromPbix"] = "TRUE"
    for dataflow in dataflows:
        data_df.loc[data_df["id"] == dataflow["id"], "import_name"] = name
        data_df.loc[data_df["id"] == dataflow["id"], "isFromPbix"] = "TRUE"
#print(data_df[data_df["import_name"] != ""])
data_df.loc[data_df["isFromPbix"] != "TRUE", "isFromPbix"] = "FALSE"
mssparkutils.fs.put("/PBIMetadata/Resources.csv", data_df.to_csv(index=False), True)

from notebookutils import mssparkutils
import requests
import json
import pandas as pd

# Helper for input date processing.
def process_date(datetime):
    date = datetime.split('T')[0]
    date_items = date.split('-')
    return date_items[1] + '/' + date_items[2] + '/' + date_items[0]

clean_reports = []
clean_pages = []

url=f'https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/admin/groups/{workspace_id}/reports'
res = requests.get(url, headers={"Authorization":"Bearer " + access_token})
reports = res.json()['value']
        
for report in reports:
    # Info from each report
    clean_reports.append({
        'ReportId': report['id'],
        'ReportName': report['name'],
        'ReportUrl': report['webUrl'],
        'ReportCreationDate': process_date(report['createdDateTime']),
        'ReportLastModificationDate': process_date(report['modifiedDateTime']),
        'ReportCreator': report['createdBy'],
        'ReportLastModifier': report['modifiedBy']
    })
    # Pages from each report
    try:
        reportId = report['id']
        url=f'https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups/{workspace_id}/reports/{reportId}/pages'
        res = requests.get(url, headers={"Authorization":"Bearer " + access_token})
        pages = res.json()['value']

    except Exception as e:
        clean_reports.pop(-1)
        continue

    for page in pages:
        clean_pages.append({
            'ReportSectionId': page['Name'],
            'ReportSectionName': page['displayName'],
            'ReportSectionOrder': page['order'],
            'ReportId': reportId
        })

reports_df = pd.DataFrame(clean_reports)
pages_df = pd.DataFrame(clean_pages)
# Store the results as csv files in the Data Warehouse

proposal_output_file_path = '/0000 Portfolio API/Proposal.xlsx'
with pd.ExcelWriter('abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net' + proposal_output_file_path) as writer:
    reports_df.to_excel(writer, sheet_name="Reports", index=False)
    pages_df.to_excel(writer, sheet_name="ReportSections", index=False)

En primer lugar cargamos el CSV a un dataframe. Dado que hay muchas columnas con diferentes tipos, podemos usar la opcion _inferSchema_ para que los tipos se deduzcan. En estos casos siempre es conveniente revisar que los tipos inferidos sean los correctos con el mtodo _printSchema_.

path= 'spotify_2022.csv'
print(path)
#df = spark.read.load(path, format='csv', inferSchema=True, header=True)
Como se puede observar, al estar el dataset bien formado los tipos inferidos son los correctos (incluso para el campo _explicit_, en el que detecta el tipo _boolean_).
Para obtener el nmero de registros podemos simplemente usar la funcin count

Para estas primeras consultas ms sencillas se usarn mtodos en vez de directamente cdigo SQL para probar ambas opciones. Ntese que la mayora de mtodos tienen dos nombres, el propio de spark y un apodo para asimilarse a la sintaxis SQL. En este caso se usar la sintaxis similar a SQL.

Para este primer ejemplo simplemente se ha realizado un select para quedarnos slo con la columna interesada y un distinct, que elimina duplicados atendiendo a todas las columnas (que tras el select, es slo _track_genre_). Al igual que ene el resto de futuras celdas, se usa show para forzar el clculo y mostrar el resultado, pasando un nmero alto  como mximo para que se vean los resultados completos.

Para el siguiente cdigo se usa una query filtrando por el artista Queen con where y ordenando de forma descendente por popularidad. Como se puede ver, es muy similar a escribir directamente SQL.

En este caso adems se pueden ver las tres formas de referirse a una columna. Si no se requiere hacer nada salvo pasarlo como argumento, se puede usar directamente el nombre. Si no, es necesario o bien acceder desde el dataframe (_df.artist_) o bien con la funcin col pasndole el nombre (_col('popularity')_).
Dado que los siguientes ejemplos son algo ms complejos, se ha optado por usar directamente SQL. Para ello es necesario en primer lugar crear una vista temporar, en este caso llamada _spotify_.

Para esta consulta es necesario en primer lugar filtrar para quedarnos slo con el gnero 'edm'. Al agrupar por artista se puede obtener la popularidad media por artista para establecer el orden descendente. Por ltimo con _LIMIT_ podemos restringir el nmero de registros, aunque si slo quisiramos limitar a 5 a la hora de mostrar se le podra pasar el 5 a la funcin _show_.

spark.sql("""SELECT artist, AVG(popularity) popularity
FROM spotify
WHERE track_genre='edm'
GROUP BY artist
ORDER BY AVG(popularity) DESC
LIMIT 5""").show()

En este caso, para hacerlo en SQL es necesario hacer una consulta algo compleja. En primer lugar, hay que hacer una agrupacin para obtener la popularidad media por artista y gnero. Tras esto, la forma ms consistente para obtener el primer elemento de cada grupo (tras agrupar por gnero) es usar el mtodo ROW_NUMBER() ordenado por popularidad (que es la popularidad media de la anterior query) y agrupada por gnero.

Por ltimo, basta con quedarse con las filas con _ROW_NUMBER==1_ (es decir, las primeras de cada gnero). Para este paso final se han usado de nuevo mtodos en vez de cdigo por comodidad (esto se puede hacer ya que el mtodo SQL devuelve un dataframe con el resultado, por lo que se puede encadenar).

spark.sql("""
    SELECT *,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY track_genre
                        ORDER BY popularity DESC) AS rank
    FROM (
        SELECT artist,
            track_genre,
            AVG(popularity) popularity
        FROM spotify
        GROUP BY artist, track_genre
        ORDER BY AVG(popularity) DESC
    )
""").select('artist', 'track_genre').where(col('rank') ==1).show(10000)

sheet_names = excel_file.sheet_names
    
for index in range(0, len(sheet_names)):
    df = pd.read_excel(excel_file, index)
    output_file_name = sheet_names[index] + '.csv'
    df.to_csv('abfss://dataxsynapsefs@adlsdatax01.dfs.core.windows.net' + output_directory_path + output_file_name, index = False)

ORDER BY AVG(popularity) DESC
LIMIT 5""").show()

En este caso, para hacerlo en SQL es necesario hacer una consulta algo compleja. En primer lugar, hay que hacer una agrupacin para obtener la popularidad media por artista y gnero. Tras esto, la forma ms consistente para obtener el primer elemento de cada grupo (tras agrupar por gnero) es usar el mtodo ROW_NUMBER() ordenado por popularidad (que es la popularidad media de la anterior query) y agrupada por gnero.

Por ltimo, basta con quedarse con las filas con _ROW_NUMBER==1_ (es decir, las primeras de cada gnero). Para este paso final se han usado de nuevo mtodos en vez de cdigo por comodidad (esto se puede hacer ya que el mtodo SQL devuelve un dataframe con el resultado, por lo que se puede encadenar).

spark.sql("""
    SELECT *,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY track_genre
                        ORDER BY popularity DESC) AS rank
    FROM (
        SELECT artist,
            track_genre,
            AVG(popularity) popularity
        FROM spotify
        GROUP BY artist, track_genre
        ORDER BY AVG(popularity) DESC
    )
""").select('artist', 'track_genre').where(col('rank') ==1).show(10000)
